publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4082 Patrick Harvie: The End of Ivor Cutler—That the Parliament celebrates the life of Ivor Cutler, poet, musician and artist, who sadly died this week after entertaining and occasionally perplexing audiences for half a century; hopes that Cutler’s passing will not stop new generations from discovering his work and delighting in it as so many have before, and, now that the coffin is closed, hopes that he enjoys the doughnut. Supported by: Chris Ballance*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Alex Johnstone*, Christine May*, Brian Adam*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Eleanor Scott*, Robin Harper*
S2M-4082 The End of Ivor Cutler (lodged on 8 March 2006) Rosie Kane*, Pauline McNeill*, Alex Neil*

S2M-4082 Patrick Harvie: The End of Ivor Cutler—That the Parliament celebrates the life of Ivor Cutler, poet, musician and artist, who sadly died this week after entertaining and occasionally perplexing audiences for half a century; hopes that Cutler’s passing will not stop new generations from discovering his work and delighting in it as so many have before, and, now that the coffin is closed, hopes that he enjoys the doughnut. Supported by: Chris Ballance, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Alex Johnstone, Christine May, Brian Adam, Mr Brian Monteith, Eleanor Scott, Robin Harper, Rosie Kane, Pauline McNeill, Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-4082 The End of Ivor Cutler (lodged on 8 March 2006) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-4082 The End of Ivor Cutler (lodged on 8 March 2006) Linda Fabiani*
